glsa.title: libssh: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libssh, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: libssh is a C library providing SSHv2 and SSHv1.

description.p: Multiple buffer overflow, double free, and integer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in libssh.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All libssh users should upgrade to the latest version:
